document.id: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 113-02-23
document.heading: Resolution Number TMBC113-02-23 of the Duly Elected and Certified Governing Body of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians

citations.citation: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 113-02-23

recital.text: the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, hereinafter referred to as the Tribe, is an unincorporated Band acting under a revised Constitution and By-Laws approved by the Secretary of the Interior on June 16th, 1959 and amendments thereto approved; and

Article IX(a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws empowers the Tribal Council with the authority to represent the Band and to negotiate with Federal, State, and Local Governments and with private persons; and

Article IX(a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws requires a 30-day comment period prior to the adoption of any ordinances or amendments to the Tribal Code, whether proposed by resolution or otherwise. Adoption must occur through a roll call vote of the Tribal Council at a publicly held meeting; and
the Tribe proposes revisions to Title 43 to provide for changes to the Lending Title to provide better protection for the tribe and the borrowers; and no
that the Tribe is approving a 30 day public comment period for proposed revisions to Title 43 of the Credit Transaction Code.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned Tribal Secretary of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, do hereby certify that the Tribal Council is composed of nine (9) members of whom seven (7) constituting a quorum were present at a meeting duly called, convened and held on the 7th day of February, 2023, that the foregoing resolution was adopted by an affirmative vote of all six (6) in favor-Reps. Lynn Gourneau, Ron Trottier, Kenneth Malaterre, Craig Lunday, Jon Jon Keplin, and Chad Counts; one (1) absent- Rep. Blaine “Slugger” Davis none (0) opposed; with the Vice-Chairman not voting.
